bioghist.p: Paul Eldridge (1888-1982) was a novelist, poet and writer of short stories. He also taught in New York City high schools from 1914-1946. His books included My First Two Thousand Years, Salome, and The Homecoming.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence, manuscripts and other materials related to Eldridge's writing and career. Materials include: manuscripts, typescripts and carbons of poems, stories and essays; scrapbooks of clippings related to Eldridge's writing and other activities; correspondence with other authors, publishers, critics, and admirers including George Sylvester Viereck (Eldridge's co-author), John Thomas Head, Tom Kennedy, and E. Haldeman-Julius; book jackets; photographs; issues of newspapers and periodicals in which his columns appeared, including the Answer, the American Freedman, the Jewish Review, Progress Monthly, Progressive World, Critic and Guide, and Jewish Forum; typescripts of "Sparks in the Wind," Eldridge's column for the Answer; correspondence to Sylvia Eldridge from others; and a typescript of Eldridge's 1913 thesis for the University of Paris on William Cullen Bryant, in French.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
